summary: This bill, the First Rhode Island Regiment Congressional Gold Medal Act, proposes awarding a Congressional Gold Medal to the First Rhode Island Regiment. The bill recognizes their service during the Revolutionary War, specifically highlighting their integrated nature, including soldiers of African heritage and Indigenous descent. The medal will be displayed at the Rhode Island State Library and duplicate bronze medals may be sold. The bill outlines the design and striking of the medal, as well as the source of funding and the status of the medals as numismatic items.
